data.text: @JoeFalconer @PhilWMagness Okay. I leave you to your world of fantasy forthwith.

@JoeFalconer @PhilWMagness With the strain vaccines were designed for? No. With the natural course of a mutating virus? Once a year, like with the flu. To say New Zealand got lucky because the virus mutated is moronic.

@gtiso @PhilWMagness Nope.

I'm saying there would be no exit without Omicron unless you want to be re-vaccinated every few weeks.

@JoeFalconer @PhilWMagness What you're saying still makes no sense. If we had reopened when the original, far less vaccine-resistant strain were around, we would see far fewer infections and hospitalisations. Because we are highly vaccinated. Maybe you need to learn to read.
@PhilWMagness And this chart shows it's possible to virtually eliminate deaths with the right strategy and a successful vaccination strategy. https://t.co/PdTDuZJr3Q
@daddy18880 @PhilWMagness Yours allowed your people to be massacred by a virus, for which I'm very sorry.
@PhilWMagness They have a lot of catching up to do on natural immunity from infection, since we know the vaccines are going to do very little in that regard.

@ggreer @PhilWMagness @len5742 Is it die to differing obesity rates, sheltering in seclusion for the entirety of the pandemic until preventative care was established, or never being seeded with soliloquy transmission vectors?
